page.title: 16HOUSES IN GOSFORTH
page.content: The earliest terraced houses are made of sandstone and the roofs are made of slate. The Causey Street houses are about 150 years old; they do not have back lanes and have little gardens in the front. In Gordon Avenue the houses have coloured glass porches and a footpath betwen each house. There is an entrance at the back. In West Avenue there are terra cotta houses with iron vance round the windows and these houses have back gardens. The Woodbine Avenue houses are very large and are used for flays, schools, surgeries and old people's homes.
